arm_group.description:
Supervised physical conditioning program of three 55—60 minute sessions per week during whole pregnancy (from week 9 to 38). Each session consists of 25-30 minutes of cardiovascular exercise,10 minutes of specific exercises (strength and balance exercises), and 10 minutes of pelvic floor muscles training
Aerobic activity was prescribed at light to moderate intensity, aiming for 55-60% of heart rate reserve. All subjects wore a heart rate (HR) monitor (Polar FT7) during the training sessions to ensure that exercise intensity was light to moderate

brief_summary.textblock:
The main aim of this study was to examine the effect of a supervised physical exercise
      program on the prevention of childhood obesity and its impact on the motor development of
      the offspring.

clinical_study.brief_title: Early Prevention of Childhood Obesity: an Active Pregnancy

detailed_description.textblock:
The environment where the fetus growths up is essential for the risk of developing some
      diseases in later life, such as obesity. Exercise has showed being useful in the prevention
      on excessive maternal weight gain which is linked to fetus weight.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Being healthy and able to exercise following American College of Obstetricians   and
             Gynecologists (ACOG) guidelines

          -  Being able to communicate in spanish

          -  Giving birth at Hospital Universitario de Torrejón, hospital Universitario de Puerta
             de Hierro and Hospital Universitario Severo Ochoa (Madrid).

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Multiparity

          -  Obstetrician complications

          -  Being interested in the study after 16 weeks

          -  Not being regular in physical exercise program

          -  Younger than 18 years old

intervention.description:
Supervised physical conditioning program of three 55—60 minute sessions per week during whole pregnancy (from week 9 to 38). Each session consists of 25-30 minutes of cardiovascular exercise,10 minutes of specific exercises (strength and balance exercises), and 10 minutes of pelvic floor muscles training
Aerobic activity was prescribed at light to moderate intensity, aiming for 55-60% of heart rate reserve. All subjects wore a heart rate (HR) monitor (Polar FT7) during the training sessions to ensure that exercise intensity was light to moderate

clinical_study.official_title: Early Prevention of Childhood Obesity: an Active Pregnancy

oversight_info.authority: Spain: Comité Ético de Investigación Clínica

primary_outcome.description: Body mass index was measured several times from 0 to 24 months
primary_outcome.measure: Body mass index of the offsprings

primary_outcome.description: Fetus body composition (percentage of fat) was measured several times from 0 to 24 months

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Maternal gestational weight gain

primary_outcome.description: Baby motor development was measured after delivery
The time needed to recovery the pre-gestational weight was assessed.
Glycemia level of the offsprings was measured  until 24 months
The level of maternal depression  was measured after delivery
Body image satisfaction was measured during and after pregnancy
primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Body image satisfaction

primary_outcome.description: Maternal quality of life was measured during and after pregnancy
primary_outcome.measure: Changes from baseline in maternal quality of life

primary_outcome.description: Placenta measurements were collected at labor

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Type of labor, stage of labor and some other maternal variables were measured at delivery
Control the level of physical activity during and after pregnancy
Health of the baby included the measurement of other variables such as blood pressure and cholesterol of the offsprings until 24 months
secondary_outcome.measure: Changes from delivery in Health of the offspring

secondary_outcome.description: Fetus outcomes were measured at delivery: Apgar score, PH umbilical cord, size and height of the baby, head circumference

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Investigator), Primary Purpose: Prevention
